docs.snippet: Judge Lawrence E. Meyers, elected in 1992 as a Republican to the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals, switched parties in 2013. Now he’s up for re-election....
docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Lawrence E. Meyers, elected in 1992 as a Republican to the Texas Court of Criminal Appeals, switched parties in 2013. Now he’s up for re-election.
docs.abstract: Interview with Texas Judge Lawrence E Meyers, senior judge and sole Democrat on State Court of Criminal Appeals, who is up for re-election; no Democrat has won a statewide office in Texas since 1994, and even Meyers was elected to court as Republican, in 1992, switching parties later in 2013.

headline.main: ‘It’s Pretty Lonely’: A Democratic Incumbent in a Sea of Texas Red
headline.print_headline: Democratic Judge Is Lonely in the Lone Star State
